thread.title: Blackmon, Ferrell & Hammons named preseason All-Big Ten
thread.title_full: Blackmon, Ferrell & Hammons named preseason All-Big Ten

title: Blackmon, Ferrell & Hammons named preseason All-Big Ten
text:
Blackmon, Ferrell & Hammons named preseason All-Big Ten 
By Eric Dutkiewicz - 21Alive October 15, 2015 Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 12:04 AM EDT 
ROSEMONT, Ill. (Big Ten Conference) - Maryland's Melo Trimble has been chosen as the Big Ten Preseason Player of the Year heading into the 2015-16 men's basketball season as voted on by a panel of conference media. The media also selected a 10-member preseason All-Big Ten team, with seven conference squads represented. 
Trimble was also a unanimous selection to the preseason All-Big Ten team, along with Michigan State's Denzel Valentine, Purdue's A.J. Hammons and Wisconsin's Nigel Hayes. Indiana's James Blackmon Jr., and Yogi Ferrell, Iowa's Jarrod Uthoff, Maryland's Jake Layman, Michigan's Caris LeVert and Wisconsin's Bronson Koenig also earned preseason All-Big Ten plaudits. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
Trimble was named a first-team All-Big Ten honoree by the media contingent last season, and was a unanimous selection to the Big Ten All-Freshman Team. Ferrell was tabbed a first-team All-Big Ten recipient by both the coaches and media, while Hammons claimed second-team honors in both ballots. Hayes and Valentine earned third-team All-Big Ten plaudits from both the coaches and media, while Uthoff was named third-team in the coaches' poll and Layman was tabbed third-team by the media. Hayes and Uthoff also earned Academic All-Big Ten laurels. 
The complete 2015-16 preseason All-Big Ten team can be found below. 
2015-16 PRESEASON BIG TEN PLAYER OF THE YEAR Melo Trimble, Maryland 
2015-16 PRESEASON ALL-BIG TEN TEAM James Blackmon Jr., Indiana
